cot.cot_output:

The Supreme Court in the Philippines has the power of judicial review, which allows it to declare laws, acts, and executive orders unconstitutional. It also has the power to interpret the Constitution and other laws, as well as to settle actual controversies involving rights which are legally demandable and enforceable.

Answer:
The power of the Supreme Court in the Philippines includes judicial review, interpretation of the Constitution and laws, and settlement of actual controversies involving legally demandable rights.
